title: SuperM, Amber and Super Junior cancel events in wake of Sulli’s death
text:
SuperM have paid their respects (Picture: Getty/EPA)

A host of K-pop stars have cancelled their activities out of respect for Sulli, who has died aged 25.

The former f(x) member passed away today in an apparent suicide, with her manager discovering her at her home in Seongnam in South Korea’s Gyeonggi Province.

In the wake of the devastating news, a number of artists from SM Entertainment and other agencies have cancelled their events.

SuperM, SM’s new super-group formed of members of SHINee, EXO, NCT127 and WayV, were set to record their show SuperM: The Beginning today at the SBS Public Hall in Seoul, but the event has been cancelled.

Super Junior cancelled their live comeback broadcast (Picture: Instagram)

Amber’s activities have been suspended (Picture: Scott Dudelson/Getty Images)

Super Junior cancelled their planned V Live broadcast to mark their Time_Slip comeback, which was planned for 10pm KST.

N.Flying cancelled their press showcase which was due to take place tomorrow afternoon, following the release of their mini album today.

And an appearance from Aron and Baekho of NU’EST on today’s edition of Jam Live has been postponed until 18 October.

SF9 star Youngbin cancelled a planned V Live broacast tonight, while actress Kim Yoo Jung cancelled her photocall at a Laneige event tomorrow.

Sulli was a member of f(x) (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

Other artists including Kang Daniel and IZ*ONE cancelled their scheduled video and blog uploads today.

And Sulli’s former f(x) bandmate Amber Liu has halted her activities for the forseeable future.

The 27-year-old wrote on her Instagram story: ‘Due to recent events I’ll be putting on hold my upcoming activities. Sorry everyone.

‘Thank you for your thoughts.’

SM Entertainment confirmed Sulli’s tragic passing in a statement issued following the news of her death.

The agency said: ‘‘We apologise for conveying such sad and unfortunate news. Sulli has left our side.

‘We cannot believe the situation now and we are just filled with grief.

‘For her family who is grieving after the sudden news of her passing, we earnestly request that you refrain from writing speculative articles or spreading rumours. We express our deep condolences.’
